intro: Physotrichia atropurpurea, commonly known as the purpleleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that often display a reddish or purplish hue. The plant produces small, inconspicuous green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Physotrichia atropurpurea is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh desert conditions.
